header.title: LESSON II COSMOLOGY
header.category: Western Esotericism, Wicca, Cosmology, Energy Work

central_thesis: The text presents a Wiccan cosmological framework where Deity is understood personally (through various forms/facets like the Triple Goddess) and universally (as an undifferentiated whole). This framework, rooted in the Vangelo delle Streghe creation myth, describes the emanation of the physical universe (God) from Spirit (Goddess) and the journey of individual souls (parts of the Goddess) through multiple lifetimes across seven planes of existence to ultimately reunite with the Divine, achievable through energy work, self-awareness, and magic.

structure_content.summary: Explores the dual nature of Deity in Wicca (personal, many-faced; universal, undifferentiated), using the diamond analogy and introducing the Vangelo delle Streghe as a foundational text for understanding creation, noting the role of reincarnation in personal deity preference.

Details the Vangelo's allegorical creation myth, wherein Primeval Deity (Diana/Crone/Hekate) divides into Goddess (Spirit) and God (Matter), leading to the universe's formation and the descent of souls through seven planes to gain experience and eventually reunite with the Divine. It describes the Goddess's yearning for union with the created universe and her subsequent 'fall' into matter through sending out souls.

Maps the practitioner's being to the cosmological model, dividing the self into Lower Self (physical, emotional, mental) and Higher Self (astral, soul, monadic, Divine), explaining how energy underlies all existence and is responsive to thought and emotion, enabling magic.

Provides foundational energy manipulation practices using Chakras (specifically palm and foot chakras) to cleanse, generate, and direct subtle energy through visualization of white light and color, emphasizing consistent practice and releasing excess energy.

Outlines a practical manifestation spell based on ethical principles ('Harm None'), visualization, affirmation, and sympathetic magic (burning paper), emphasizing the importance of belief, emotional engagement, and non-obsession for successful results.

structure_content.chapter_title: GOD OF THE MONTH The Triple Goddess
structure_content.summary: Explains the Goddess's role as creator and the God as Her consort/child, clarifying their Yin/Yang relationship and focusing on the Triple Goddess (Maiden, Mother, Crone) as a primary form of reverence in Wicca, mirroring the phases of the moon.

Defines key terms used throughout the lesson, providing technical precision for concepts like Patron, Universal Deity, Primeval Deity, Chaos, Crone, Hekate, Seven Planes, Vibration, Music of the Spheres, Destiny, Veil, Born Old, Lower Self, Higher Self, Astral Self, Egoic/Soul, Monad, and Chakra.

key_concepts.definition: A specific Deity (God or Goddess) with whom an individual forms a personal relationship, seeking guidance, inspiration, and practical help in daily life and esoteric matters.
A person attached, or devoted, to a particular Patron deity.
The infinite, unnamed, and formless spirit of Deity, beyond human comprehension, which is accessed through various personal forms or facets, and is the ultimate universal power.
A foundational Aradian Wiccan scripture containing the creation story, the Charge of the Goddess, and other myths, historically published by Charles Leland as 'Aradia, or the Gospel of the Witches'.
The art of using easily understandable symbols and narratives to describe difficult or abstract concepts, such as the interaction of spirit and body in Pagan religion.
The God/dess existing before creation, an androgynous, undifferentiated state (Chaos) containing all spiritual and material seeds, often represented as the Androgyne or the Crone.

The primordial state of Deity before creation, a dreamlike and undifferentiated wholeness (Unity/Union) containing the beginnings of all that is given form in the physical world; it is both the starting and ending point of creation.

The aged aspect of the Goddess, represented by the Waning Moon, ruling over wisdom, understanding, magic, transformation, and the dissolution of outmoded forms; often equated with Primordial Deity and Hekate.
The great Crone Goddess of ancient Greece, patroness of magic, wisdom, and the spiritworld, often identified with the Crone aspect of Deity.

Also called Spheres or Dimensions; hierarchical levels of existence (Physical, Emotional, Mental, Astral, Soular/Egoic, Monadic, Divine) representing progressive densities of matter and slower vibrations, from the lowest (Physical) to the highest (Divine).
The rate at which energy moves, directly correlating with density: slower vibration equates to denser matter (physical plane), while faster vibration equates to more spiritual energy (Divine plane).
The concept that each of the seven planes has a unique energy vibration that translates into a corresponding sound, forming the theoretical basis for using sound in energetic healing and magic.

An ancient concept where the Goddess (Spirit/nature of life) spins the thread of life (destiny) and the God (Matter/process of living) turns the wheel, facilitating experience and growth for all beings through movement through the Planes of Existence.
The lessons and opportunities for growth and advancement chosen by the soul prior to birth, with the ultimate outcome determined by individual choices and actions.
A symbolic barrier that obscures the conscious self's perception of higher aspects of being and higher planes of existence, requiring dedicated magical and psychic work to thin or part it.
Individuals who are born with a naturally thin Veil, allowing easier access to psychic and magical skills from birth due to extensive spiritual work in prior lifetimes.
The easily perceived aspects of a being, comprising the physical body (1st Dimension), emotions (2nd Dimension), and thinking mind (3rd Dimension).

The deeper, less consciously accessible aspects of a being, including the Astral self (4th Dimension), Egoic/Soul (5th Dimension), Monad (6th Dimension), and the Divine/Goddess Herself (7th Dimension).
The 4th Dimensional aspect of the Higher Self, also called the Causal or Intuitional/Buddhic self, which determines life experiences and lessons, and is the level at which magic is worked.
The 5th Dimensional aspect of the Higher Self, representing the unique personality built from accumulated experiences and lessons across many lifetimes, storing all benefits and knowledge.

The 6th Dimensional aspect of the Higher Self, a perfect 'single unit' and Divine Spark of Life, conscious of itself as a distinct portion of Deity, serving as the motivating force for evolution and union with the Goddess.
The 7th Dimensional aspect, representing the single soul of the Universe, the ultimate origin and destination of all beings, and the very center of one's being.
The fundamental substance of the universe and all beings, which is responsive to thought and emotion and can be consciously manipulated through magical practice for specific effects.
Energy centers in the body that connect body and Spirit, linked by meridians; major chakras correspond to the seven planes of existence and are used for drawing in and sending out energy.

practical_system.description: The system integrates a cosmological understanding of Deity, planes of existence, and the multi-layered self with practical energy manipulation and manifestation techniques. It emphasizes the importance of emotional connection to Deity, ethical conduct ('Harm None'), and the belief that energy responds to thought and emotion. The operative goal is spiritual growth, accessing higher consciousness, and manifesting desires by consciously working with energy, primarily through visualization and affirmation.
tools: For Energy Exercises: Primarily internal visualization and awareness of palm and sole Chakras.
For Manifestation Spell: Candle (white or red), a lighter or matches, a piece of paper, a writing implement, a burning dish (e.g., brass incense burner), and a stick or knife for stirring ashes.
rituals: Releasing Exercise: A preparatory practice involving closing eyes and visualizing worries/anxieties pouring out like water through palms and soles to clear excess energy before magical work.

White Light Energy Ball/Beam (Exercise #1 & #2): Visualization practices to generate a ball of white light between the palms, stretch it into a beam, then expand it into a larger ball, and finally dissipate it, focusing on energy manipulation and control.

Rainbow Energy Beam (Exercise #3): A variation of the light exercise, visualizing a rainbow beam between hands to work with the varied effects of different colors on energy, used to strengthen on multiple levels.

Manifestation Spell: A structured ritual involving: releasing tension, meditating on a clearly visualized desire, writing the desire on paper, lighting a candle, visualizing white light in the chest, affirmations of connection to universal power and manifestation, sympathetic magic through burning the paper (with the burn's characteristics serving as an omen), and post-ritual clearing, releasing, and non-obsession.

relevant_quotes.text: The best analogy of how Wiccans look at Deity is the famous example of the diamond. We think of Deity rather like an enormous diamond of many facets. Each facet is beautiful in and of itself, and can be used as a way to access the heart of the diamond, but in reality each is only a different way of looking at the same stone.
Diana was the first created of all creation. In Her were all things.
Out of Herself, the first Darkness, She divided Herself. Into Darkness and Light She was divided. The God, Her brother and son, Herself and Her other Self, was the Light.”
To rise You must fall. To become the greatest of all Goddesses, You must first become a mortal.”
She sang a charm, and her voice was as the buzzing of bees. And then Diana sat at Her spinning wheel and began to spin the thread of life, and the God turned the wheel.

The Vibration of that energy, it's movement -sometimes described as 'Frequency' - is what makes it work, and determines on what level it works. The denser or more physical a thing is the lower it's Vibration or frequency is said to be. The more Spiritual the energy, the higher it's Vibration is said to be.
Descending through the Planes of Existence was like going through a curtain, or VEIL. The Veil obscures our vision of the things above us.
Energy reacts to thought and emotion -this is why by rising to your Higher Self -specifically the Astral level- you can effect and control energy, i.e.; work magic.
magic will not work if you don't believe it will work -because energy responds to thought and emotion.

There is one power in he Universe, and I am a perfect manifestation of that power. And as such I will that even as this paper burns, so too shall this which I have written come to pass. May it come to me easily, and with harm to none. I will it. I draw it to me. I manifest it. I accept it. I receive it. I give thanks for it. By my will, so mote it be.”

critical_analysis.relevance: This text provides a fundamental, accessible, yet detailed introduction to Wiccan cosmology, metaphysics, and practical energy work. It contextualizes magical practice within a broader spiritual journey of self-realization and reunion with the Divine. It is particularly relevant for understanding the philosophical underpinnings of Correllian Wicca and its approach to divinity as both personal and universal.
critical_analysis.target_audience: Beginners in Wicca and other nature-based spiritual paths, students of esotericism interested in Wiccan philosophy and practical magic, and those seeking a structured approach to energy manipulation and manifestation within a modern magical context.
